channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023090762
item.description:
Report E-2023090762

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver thought he was in position under the unloading rack but the employee asked him to move a few feet backwards. The driver knowingly tried to move with the dome lid open (which goes against our training policies). The unloader told him to stop and he hit the brakes hard and product surged. 3 gallons spilled out in the crash box and down the sides of the trailer. He used a spill pad to clea n up what was on the ground and then worked with the customer to get the exterior of the trailer cleaned off.

item.title: Report X-2023090374
item.description:
Report X-2023090374

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: BLAUVELT
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking during the drivers route, and was immediately brought back to the station for inspection. Package was then placed into a red Hazmat bin and chemical neutralizer was placed over the area of spillage. Upon inspection of the package it was discovered that 1 gallon of muriatic acid had leaked from a puncture/crack at the bottom of the bottle. DescribePack: One small hole at the bottom of a 1 gallon bottle of muriatic acid. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Chemical neutralizer was placed over spill and cleaned with spill absorbent pads after spill was neutralized.

item.title: Report X-2023090331

Report X-2023090331

  • City: BRONX

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking out trailer and was placed into a QA hazmat bin and placed in the designated hazmat area. This was done immediately to prevent any unwanted exposure to hazardous materials. DescribePack: The leaking of hazmat material is occuring in the medivators rapicide part a inside inner box. The bottles both have premade holes but one of the holes are leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed immediately in a QA hazmat bin to mitigate effects of release.

item.title: Report X-2023090304
item.description:
Report X-2023090304

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: CHEEKTOWAGA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on van line 1 rollers. Package handler was carrying the package. Wet spot in cardboard from preexisting leak. Weight of 1 gallon jug pushed through the wet cardboard. Container landed on the floor and the cap broke off the top of the container. Package was already wet and leaking before container fell out to the floor. After reviewing damage, it was found the foil seal on the bottle was punctured. Unable to tell when this occurred but may have led to initial leakage which then caused the integrity of the box to weaken and led to the container falling out. DescribePack: Box was already wet when further damage occurred when item fell out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Management cleared the area and quality assurance contained the spill. Absorbent was used to soak up the spillage and container was placed in a red hazmat tote, lined with a plastic hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023090288
item.description:
Report X-2023090288

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found giving of irritating fumes. Package was then contained within a hazmat bag where it could be inspected. It was found that the inner canister had hazmat labeling and the sds for the contents confirmed. DescribePack: The liquid was leaking out from around the rim of the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking container was place withing a hazmat bag and salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023082070
item.description:
Report X-2023082070

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: PLATTSBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We received a trailer from the Syracuse facility. When opened the HAZMAT was discovered on the bottom of an entire wall of the trailer under immense pressure from all the other packages on top. The package handler that was assigned to the trailer at the time had seen this event and called out that there was a leaking HAZMAT present inside the trailer. A manager then advised them to step out of the trailer and continue working elsewhere. After it was discovered the QA employee at the time went over with a HAZMAT bucket and picked it up and swiftly put the HAZMAT in a salvage drum. The proper steps were NOT followed completely. The SDS was never pulled when it was found leaking. DescribePack: When inspected later on the next day, it was discovered that a leaking cap was causing the slow leak. The weight from other packages on top of the HAZMAT caused a cap to come loose. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2023082063
item.description:
Report X-2023082063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 1 drum was found with cap loose from the drum. The drum was put into the hazmat area and put it in the plastic bag. DescribePack: The cap of the drum was loose and unable to closed. The cap was pressed on by speciality tool and can not be resealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was used to prevent the spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023082041
item.description:
Report X-2023082041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ITEM WAS PULLED FROM TRAILER AND PULLED AWAY FROM UNLOAD AND PLACED IN A BIN FOR HAZMATS DescribePack: QA WAS CALLED TO THE BELT TO CHECK ON PACKAGE UPON FURTHER INSPECTION QA SAW THAT THE CAP WAS LOOSE ON THE CAN INSIDE, ITEM DOESNT LEAK UNLESS TURNED UPSIDEDOWN WHICH IN TURN WAS DUE TO BAD HANDLING ITEMS WERE REPACKED IN A DRUM WAITING FOR DESPOSITION DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA WAS CALLED TO ASSESS PACKAGE AND CLEAN AREA
